chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole A Harmel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.
May be transferred to Winnebago County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign release for Agent.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole A Harmel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment. On Count 2
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicole A Harmel in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed in Court.  Attorney Scholz waives formal reading.  Defendant pleads no contest to the amended counts #1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  

Court orders the following to count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS consecutive.
Term of Probation: 1 Years, may be transferred to Winnebago County. 
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent. 
Sign  Release for Agent;
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
COSTS:  $243.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count 2
Sentence of:
20 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by Friday 1/22/16 at 5:00 pm.
COSTS:  $243.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant Nicole A Harmel in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicole A Harmel in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waiting on a pretrial offer.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nicole A Harmel in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with witnesses listed in the complaint or the officer listed in the complaint unless in an emergency situation.  Defendant to not be present at any establishment that sells or serves alcohol as a primary purpose.

Defendant Nicole A Harmel in court, in custody, with attorney Amy C Scholz.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
